title: E equals mc squared - rank energies for X Y and He

content.question:
<math alttext="X with mass number A and atomic number Z, reacts to form, Y with mass number A minus 4 and atomic number Z minus 2, plus H e with mass number 4 and atomic number 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mi>Z</mi><mi>A</mi></mmultiscripts><mo>→</mo><mmultiscripts><mtext>Y</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mi>Z</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo>+</mo><mmultiscripts><mtext>He</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math>
The nuclear process shown depicts a hypothetical nucleus <math alttext="X with mass number A and atomic number Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mi>Z</mi><mi>A</mi></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math> becoming two new nuclei, <math alttext="Y with mass number A minus 2 and atomic number Z minus 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Y</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mi>Z</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H e with mass number 4 and atomic number 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>He</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math>. What is the relation among the following energy quantities? Assume that the <math alttext="X with mass number A and atomic number Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mi>Z</mi><mi>A</mi></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math> nucleus is initially at rest and has zero kinetic energy.

<math alttext="E sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>, the equivalent energy of the <math alttext="X with mass number A and atomic number Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mi>Z</mi><mi>A</mi></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math> mass, which is <math alttext="open parenthesis, A plus 0.0300, close parenthesis, atomic mass units" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>0.0300</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> u</mtext></math>

<math alttext="E sub Y plus H e, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>Y+He</mtext></msub></math>, the sum of the equivalent energies of the <math alttext="Y with mass number A minus 2 and atomic number Z minus 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Y</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mi>Z</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H e with mass number 4 and atomic number 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>He</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math> masses, which are <math alttext="open parenthesis, A minus 4, plus 0.0200, close parenthesis, atomic mass units" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.0200</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> u</mtext></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, 4.0026, close parenthesis, atomic mass units" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4.0026</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> u</mtext></math>, respectively

<math alttext="K sub Y plus H e, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y+He</mtext></msub></math>, the sum of the kinetic energies of the <math alttext="Y with mass number A minus 2 and atomic number Z minus 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Y</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mi>Z</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math>and <math alttext="H e with mass number 4 and atomic number 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mmultiscripts><mtext>He</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mmultiscripts></mstyle></math> nuclei
